B2 the hot gas that is produced when water boils: Steam rose from the simmering stew. steam turbines a steam engine/locomotive the age of steam (= the period when steam provided power for railways and factories) The pump is driven by steam.
More examplesFewer examplesIf water is heated to 100°C it turns to steam.The steam from the kettle misted up her glasses.The horses came to a halt, steam streaming from their nostrils.The shower room was full of steam.My new wallpaper stripper uses high-pressure steam to lift off the paper.
